But the most important condition of peace was understood rather than expressed in the treaty. Aurelian withdrew the Roman forces from Dacia, and tacitly relinquished that great province to the Goths and Vandals ²². His manly judgement convinced him of the solid advantage& and taught him to despise the seeming disgrace, of thus contracting the frontiers of the monarchy.
